# Arpeggio: Major 7b5 in C 

## Brief Presentation

The Major 7b5 arpeggio is a unique and colorful musical entity that combines the elegance of a major 7th chord with the edginess of a diminished 5th interval. This arpeggio consists of the root (C), major third (E), diminished fifth (Gb), and major seventh (B) of a C Major 7b5 chord. It is often used to add tension and intrigue to musical passages and solos.

## Notes and Intervals

- C (Root)
- E (Major Third)
- Gb (Diminished Fifth)
- B (Major Seventh)

This arpeggio can be seen as a C Major 7 chord with a flat 5th interval (Gb) added to it, creating a unique and dissonant sound.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The Major 7b5 arpeggio is often used in Jazz, Fusion, and Contemporary styles of music. It provides a sophisticated and modern flavour to compositions and improvisations. When played with the right phrasing and context, this arpeggio can evoke a sense of mystery and tension, making it a versatile tool for creative expression.
